title: Web Development Fundamentals
description: Test your knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript fundamentals, responsive design, and accessibility concepts.

questions.question: Which HTML5 element is used to define important text?
questions.explanation: The <strong> element is used to define text with strong importance. The content inside is typically displayed in bold.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
questions.explanation: The 'color' property is used to set the color of text in CSS.

questions.question: What does the 'z-index' property in CSS control?
options: The horizontal position of an element
The zoom level of an element
questions.explanation: The z-index property specifies the stack order of an element (which element should be placed in front of, or behind, the others).

questions.question: Which JavaScript method is used to add an element at the end of an array?
questions.explanation: The push() method adds new items to the end of an array and returns the new length of the array.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid way to declare a variable in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: JavaScript does not have an 'int' keyword for variable declaration. The valid keywords are 'var', 'let', and 'const'.

questions.question: What does the following CSS selector target? .header > p
options: All p elements inside an element with class 'header'
All p elements with a class of 'header'
Only p elements that are direct children of an element with class 'header'
The first p element inside an element with class 'header'
questions.explanation: The '>' selector selects elements that are direct children of the specified element. In this case, it selects all p elements that are direct children of elements with the class 'header'.

questions.question: What does the following HTML attribute do?
options: Provides alternative text for the image if it cannot be displayed
Sets an alert to appear when the image is clicked
Defines the alignment of the image
Changes the image when hovered over
questions.explanation: The 'alt' attribute provides alternative text for an image if the image cannot be displayed. It's also important for accessibility as screen readers read this text.

questions.question: Which CSS layout mode is designed to create flexible responsive layouts without using floats or positioning?
questions.explanation: Flexbox (Flexible Box Module) is specifically designed to create flexible responsive layouts without the need for floats or positioning.

questions.question: In JavaScript, what is the difference between '==' and '==='?
options: No difference, they can be used interchangeably
== compares only value, === compares both value and type
== is used for assignment, === is used for comparison
questions.explanation: == is the equality operator that compares values but performs type coercion if necessary. === is the strict equality operator that compares both values and types without type coercion.

questions.question: Which CSS property would you use to create space between the elements' border and its content?
questions.explanation: The padding property creates space between an element's border and its content.

questions.question: What does the following JavaScript code do? document.getElementById('demo').innerHTML = 'Hello';
options: Creates a new HTML element with ID 'demo'
Changes the content of an HTML element with ID 'demo' to 'Hello'
Selects all elements with the class 'demo'
Adds 'Hello' to the end of an element with ID 'demo'
questions.explanation: This code selects an HTML element with the ID 'demo' and sets its inner HTML content to 'Hello'.

questions.question: Which HTML5 element is used to specify a footer for a document or section?
questions.explanation: The <footer> element defines a footer for a document or section. It typically contains authorship information, copyright information, contact information, etc.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML for creating a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: The correct HTML for creating a hyperlink is using the <a> tag with the href attribute to specify the URL.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to make text bold?
questions.explanation: The font-weight property in CSS is used to set how thick or thin characters in text should be displayed.

questions.question: What does 'responsive web design' mean?
options: Websites that respond to user inputs quickly
Websites that automatically respond to the user's preferences
Websites that change layout based on the user's device screen size
Websites with a good server response time
questions.explanation: Responsive web design is an approach to web design that makes web pages render well on a variety of devices and window or screen sizes.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'media' attribute in HTML?
options: To specify what media/device the linked document is optimized for
To identify the media type of the server
To define where the media should be stored in the browser
To determine the media playback quality
questions.explanation: The 'media' attribute specifies what media/device the linked document is optimized for. It's commonly used with CSS stylesheets to apply different styles for different devices.

questions.question: What does the following JavaScript code return? typeof([]);
questions.explanation: In JavaScript, arrays are actually objects, so typeof([]) returns 'object'. To check if something is an array, you would use Array.isArray().

questions.question: Which CSS property would you use to add shadows to elements?
questions.explanation: The box-shadow property is used to add shadow effects around an element's frame.

questions.question: What does ARIA stand for in web development?
questions.explanation: ARIA stands for Accessible Rich Internet Applications. It's a set of attributes that define ways to make web content and applications more accessible to people with disabilities.

questions.question: Which of the following is the correct way to comment in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: In JavaScript, single-line comments start with //. Although /* */ is also valid for multi-line comments, // is the most common way to comment single lines.
